title: Rome IV Diagnostic Criteria for Cannabinoid Hyperemesis Syndrome (CHS)
desc: The Rome IV Criteria for Cannabinoid Hyperemesis Syndrome (CHS) provides criteria for diagnosis of cannabinoid hyperemesis syndrome.

orgreference.text: Stanghellini V, Chan FK, Hasler WL, et al. Gastroduodenal Disorders. Gastroenterology. 2016;150(6):1380-92.

data.evidence:
To fulfill the Rome IV criteria for cannabinoid hyperemesis syndrome,* patient must have the following (for 3 months prior with symptom onset ≥6 months ago):

  1. Stereotypical episodic vomiting resembling cyclic vomiting syndrome (CVS) in terms of onset, duration, and frequency.
  2. Presentation after prolonged excessive cannabis use.
  3. Relief of vomiting episodes by sustained cessation of cannabis use.

*May be associated with pathologic bathing behavior (prolonged hot baths or showers).
